abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Information and
            Communications Infrastructure (ICT) Development Project for
            Mongolia are to:  (a) significantly increase the coverage
            and use of relevant ICT services among the rural population
            through an incentive program designed to encourage the
            participation of private operators in the rural segment of
            the ICT market; and (b) increase private sector
            participation in the delivery of e-Government services,
            thereby improving public sector utilization of ICT. The
            closing date for grants is proposed to be extended by one
            year from March 31, 2012 until March 31, 2013 in order to
            allow for the implementation of the two e-Government
            applications (Public Key Infrastructure and Certification
            Authority, or PKI & CA and Portal System) to be
            completed within the proposed extended closing date in line
            with the actions agreed with the Government of Mongolia.
            This extension will have no effect on the achievement of the
            original project results other than the time delay. This
            will be the first extension of the project. The extension
            meets the criteria of OP 13.30, i.e., (a) the project
            objectives continue to be achievable; (b) the performance of
            the borrower and project implementing agencies is
            satisfactory; and (c) the borrower has agreed a specific
            action plan with the World Bank to complete the project.
